column5: Hello All,Here is a highlight reel I put together, showing some 'hits' and 'misses' from a topwater largemouth outing the other week. Can't beat glass-calm water, a LiveTarget frog, and hungry fall largies.(watch in 1080p HD for best quality)Cheers,Justin

Had to wait til I got home to watch Justin. As you know,I like watching your bass adventures.  That first spot with the scattered pads. Those are my favorite kind of spots.  On to 3:34.  Kinda reminded me of a baseball game. Swing batta batta batta swing.  Like you said. Not a big one,but still fun to catch.  Thanks buddy.

Thanks for the comments, guys - much appreciated. Was definitely a fun day on the water. Was fishing scattered vegetation in water between 3 and 5 feet deep. As for the fish at the 2:15 mark - probably should have reached for the net  It was a decent fish.Nothing overly big that day but always fun when you get them - or miss them - on top.  Already looking forward to next season...at least for the topwater aspect.  Brian - I was determined to get that fish at 3:34, lol! Besides, I had a boat full of spectators passing by  Good Fishing,  Justin
Very nice video.  Was that a tour boat right at the end there?
Haven't done the top water for bass for some years now, but boy was it fun.     Thanks for sharing the video.
Love the Rideau!.  Great vid.  Looks serene
